intro: Excoecaria biglandulosa var. petiolaris, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and distinctive yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces a milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardening.
